titleStmt.title: By His Excellency a proclamation. Whereas His Majesty hath been graciously pleased, by his royal letter, bearing date the sixteenth day of October last past, to signifie that he hath received undoubted advice that a great and sudden invasion from Holland, with an armed force of forreigners and strangers, will speedily be made in an hostile manner upon His Majesty's kingdom of England ...
titleStmt.author: Territory and Dominion of New-England. President (1686-1689 : Andros)

titleStmt.title: By His Excellency a proclamation. Whereas His Majesty hath been graciously pleased, by his royal letter, bearing date the sixteenth day of October last past, to signifie that he hath received undoubted advice that a great and sudden invasion from Holland, with an armed force of forreigners and strangers, will speedily be made in an hostile manner upon His Majesty's kingdom of England ...
titleStmt.author: Territory and Dominion of New-England. President (1686-1689 : Andros)
Andros, Edmund, Sir, 1637-1714.

notesStmt.note: "Given at Fort-Charles at Pemaquid, the tenth day of January, in the fourth year of the reign of our sovereign Lord James the second, of England, Scotland, France and Ireland King, defender of the faith &c."
Date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Massachusetts Historical Society Library.
